alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 01 at 3:23PM MDT until September 01 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 323 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Steins. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 25. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Shakespeare, and Pyramid Mountains. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this area of blowing dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
